revised_title: Excitation of Beta-Rays by Alpha-Rays: A Study of Radiation Types
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to investigate the excitation of beta-rays by alpha-rays in various substances. They discovered that certain elements and compounds produce characteristic radiations when exposed to alpha-rays, which can be analyzed and compared to X-ray-excited radiations. The study provides insights into the types of radiation emitted by radioactive substances and their interactions with matter.
